name: tautness
content:
tautness noun [U]
(TIGHTNESS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being tight or completely stretched: The symptoms of sunburn include hot, painful skin, redness and tautness. Her stomach had lost some of its former tautness after the birth of her sons.

tautness noun [U]
(EXCITEMENT/NERVOUSNESS)
the quality of being excited or nervous, or of causing someone to feel like this: He carries himself with a certain tautness, a live-wire constantly on the verge of snapping. The music is even more thrilling, with a tautness and tension that are spine-chilling.

tautness noun [U]
(IN WRITING/SPEECH)
(in writing or speech) the quality of being controlled, clear, and short: She did not understand the tautness in the teacher's tone. The author is first and foremost a poet, and the linguistic tautness of the book reflects this.
